message: Hello Bob, thank you for considering my product. I'm excited to discuss the price with you. After careful consideration, I'm willing to offer you the product for $18,000. This is a great opportunity for you to get a high-quality product at a competitive price. I'm looking forward to hearing your thoughts.

Hello Alice, thanks for the offer. However, $18,000 is a bit high for my budget. I'd be willing to pay $10,000 for the product.  It's a fair price that allows me to get a good deal while still providing you with a reasonable profit.

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I understand that $10,000 is a bit low for me, but I'm willing to compromise. I can offer you the product for $14,000. This price is still a good deal for you, and it's closer to my minimum price. I'm open to further negotiations, but I need to make sure I get a fair price for my product.
Hi Alice, I appreciate you moving closer to my budget.  How about we meet in the middle at $12,000?  That would be a fair deal for both of us.

Hi Bob, I understand your proposal to meet in the middle, but I'm still not comfortable with $12,000. I'm willing to make one more concession. I can offer you the product for $13,500. This is my final compromise, and I hope you can see the value in the product at this price.

Alice, I appreciate you coming down further. I understand this is your final offer, but I'm just not able to meet that price. If you're willing to reconsider $12,000, I'm ready to close the deal right now. Otherwise, I'll unfortunately need to explore other options.

Bob, I understand your persistence, but I'm not willing to go back to $12,000. I've already compromised a lot, and I need to make sure I get a fair price for my product. I'm willing to make one more offer. I can give you the product for $13,000. This is my last offer, and I hope you can see the value in the product at this price.
